meanings.definition: The pulsation of the heart, especially as felt in the arteries.
meanings.sent1: I could feel my heartbeat quicken as I ran towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The doctor listened to my heartbeat with a stethoscope during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: His heartbeat was so loud that it sounded like a drum beating in his chest.
meanings.sent4: In the silence of the night, the only sound was the steady heartbeat of the old clock on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic heartbeat of the music filled the room, calming everyone down.

meanings.definition: A single pulsation of the heart.
meanings.sent1: After a moment of stillness, I felt a strong heartbeat in my chest.
meanings.sent2: With each heartbeat, blood is pumped throughout the body to deliver oxygen.
meanings.sent3: Her heartbeat was like a drumroll, building up to an exciting moment.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence was broken by the loud heartbeat echoing in the room.
meanings.sent5: The irregular heartbeat made it difficult for the doctor to monitor her condition.

meanings.definition: A very brief moment or instant.
meanings.sent1: In a heartbeat, everything changed, and life took a new turn.
meanings.sent2: She made the decision in a heartbeat, without any hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The heartbeat of the lightning strike lit up the dark sky for a split second.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stop for a heartbeat, allowing him to make a quick decision.
meanings.sent5: The heartbeat of excitement in the room was palpable as the surprise was revealed.
